intro: Biscutella laevigata var. styriaca, commonly known as the Styrian biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
